note.p: Education: Rev Richard Norris's School at Drogheda; Trinity College, Dublin; BA (1676), MA (1679), BD (1687), DD (1692)

Career: Fellow of Trinity College, Dublin (1679); Donegal Lecturer and Professor of Mathematics at Trinity (1685); fled to England; Chaplain to Lord Paget, Ambassador of William III to Vienna (1689); Provost of Trinity (1692); Bishop of Cloyne (1695-1697); Bishop of Clogher (1697-1717); Vice-Chancellor of Dublin University (1702); Bishop of Derry (1717-death); left his mathematical books to Trinity
Memberships: Dublin Philosophical Society; Oxford Philosophical Society
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hoppen; Gunther; Burtchaell
References: K Theodore Hoppen, 'The Royal Society and Ireland. II' in NR 1965 vol 20 pp 78-99
